section.para: The ngx_stream_proxy_module module (1.7.7) allows passing connections to another server over TCP and UNIX-domain sockets.

para.note: This module is available as part of our commercial subscription.

directive.name: proxy_connect_timeout
directive.para: Defines a timeout for establishing a connection with a proxied server.

directive.name: proxy_downstream_buffer
directive.para: Sets the size of the buffer used for reading data from the client.

directive.name: proxy_pass
directive.para: If a domain name resolves to several addresses, all of them will be used in a round-robin fashion. In addition, an address can be specified as a server group.

directive.name: proxy_timeout
directive.para: Defines a timeout used after the proxying to the backend had started.

directive.name: proxy_upstream_buffer
directive.para: Sets the size of the buffer used for reading data from the upstream server.
